definition: evergreen pine and cypress (idiom); steadfast nobility
loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)

sentences.english: The pine and the cypress remain green all the year round.
The river is accompanied by evergreen pines, hill ranges and wreathing mist.
sentences.chinese: 河道两岸苍松翠柏，石山绵连，云雾缭绕。

sentences.english: Feibao Artesian Bore Baths Calocedrus pines and then you back into the embrace of nature.
sentences.chinese: 飞瀑流泉和苍松翠柏又把你带回大自然的怀抱之中。

sentences.english: The entire cemetery in Cangsong Cuibai surrounded in solemn silence.
sentences.chinese: 整个墓地在苍松翠柏环抱中，庄严肃穆。

sentences.english: Mountainous cliffs, looming in among the pines and cypresses.
sentences.chinese: 峰峦峭壁，隐现于苍松翠柏之中。

sentences.english: Like pines and cypresses, his qualities are forever great.
sentences.chinese: 他高尚的品格好比苍松翠柏，万古长青。

sentences.english: The Longdong Nunnery hidden in pines and cypresses, backs on to the mountain and faces south.
sentences.chinese: 龙洞庵背依高山，坐北面南，掩映于苍松翠柏之中。

definition: pine and cypress/fig. chaste and undefiled/fig. tomb
hidden from view/alternately hidden and visible/setting off each other
verdant/lush green and full of life
the peaks of a mountain range
(of an area) to have trees with shade-giving foliage/(of a road) to be tree-lined
